data.title: MATLAB - Technology Help
data.meta_description: MATLAB is a multi-paradigm numerical computing environment. A proprietary programming language developed by MathWorks, MATLAB allows matrix manipulations, plotting of functions and data, implementation of algorithms, creation of user interfaces, and interfacing with programs written in other languages, including C, C++, C#, Java, Fortran and Python.
data.text:
MATLAB is a multi-paradigm numerical computing environment.

Installing MATLAB

On my College-owned device

Faculty and Staff may install MATLAB using the Software Center for Windows or Managed Software Center for Macs.

If you do not see it listed in Software Center, please contact the Help Desk at help@lafayette.edu or (610) 330-5501.

On my personal device

download the installer

Log into the MathWorks website.

If you don’t have a MathWorks account, click the Create button under Create a MathWorks Account. Fill out the form to create the MathWorks account.

If you have a MathWorks account, Sign in using the Lafayette credentials at the sign in when prompted.

Once logged into your MathWorks account, choose the installer that matches your computer’s operating system.

Install and activate MATLAB

Locate the downloaded MATLAB installer, unzip it, and install it following the prompts.

Enter your Lafayette email address and click Next. You will then be prompted for your Lafayette credentials.

Accept the license agreement.

Select MATLAB (individual). Select the default destination.

Select the products you want to install, then follow the prompts to install them.

Once the application is installed, launch MATLAB. Click Sign In located in upper right part of the MATLAB screen. Sign in using your @lafayette email address and Lafayette credentials when prompted.

Update MATLAB

On my College-owned device

Updates will be provided via the Software Center for Windows or Managed Software Center for Macs.

If you do not see the latest version listed in Software Center, please contact the Help Desk at help@lafayette.edu or (610) 330-5501.
